sections.title: Consultation, suitability, then a tailored plan
sections.body: You’ll meet a clinician to discuss your concerns—anxiety, gag reflex, jaw tension, or the need for a longer visit. We review your health, medications, and previous experiences before advising on sedation or alternative calming support.
bullets: Medical history, airway, and medication review
Discuss when sedation helps—long treatments, complex care, or severe anxiety
Explain what to expect, including escorts and fasting if required
Share options for non-sedation support (calming environments, comfort tech like The Wand)
Agree next steps, including links to implant or emergency care if relevant

faqs.question: Is sedation right for everyone?
faqs.answer: Not always. We review your medical history, medications, and needs first. If it isn’t suitable, we can use other calming support and comfort tech.

faqs.question: Will I be asleep?
faqs.answer: Sedation aims to relax you while keeping you responsive. It is not general anaesthesia; you’ll be monitored throughout and recovery is supervised.

faqs.question: Can I use sedation for longer implant or restorative treatments?
faqs.answer: Yes when appropriate. We’ll discuss suitability, coordination with your implant or complex care plan, and any extra recovery time.

faqs.question: What if I have a strong gag reflex?
faqs.answer: Sedation can help reduce gagging, and we combine it with techniques like gentle numbing and paced breaks.

faqs.question: How should I prepare?
faqs.answer: We provide written guidance on fasting (if needed), medication timing, and arranging an escort. You’ll also receive contact details if questions arise.
